title.narrative: Engaging Chinese Scholars on Int'l Human Rights

description.narrative:
This project supported a long-standing Chatham House initiative to promote engagement with Chinese international law academics working on international human rights law and related issues. Specifically, the grant contributed to a four-day programme of meetings in Geneva from 5-8 March 2016 including a two-day roundtable meeting for a global experts network.
Objectives of the Geneva programme were to:
1. Create a platform for Chinese international law academics working on international human rights law issues to present their thinking and exchange ideas with counterparts from outside China;
2. Support networking between Chinese and non-Chinese academics working on international human rights and related areas of public international law; and
3. Build stronger understanding within the wider international law community of intellectual debates taking place in China about the international human rights system and China's role within it.
DFAT’s contribution was $13,968.62.
